QuestionTxt: (Next I would like to ask you about some things that have been in the news. Not everyone will have heard about them.)...Since the start of the military action in Iraq last March (2003), about how many U.S. (United States) soldiers have been killed? To the best of your knowledge, has it been under 500, 500 to 1000, 1000 to 2000, or more than 2000? (If Respondent says '500', '1000' or '2,000', prompt:) Would you say it is a little over or a little under?
SurveySponsor: Pew Research Center for the People & the Press
SourceDoc: Pew Research Center for the People & the Press Biennial Media Consumption Survey
